text:
Hello,

I am trying to compile the tomcat webapp module 1.0 on a Solaris 8 system and I
am am getting these messages when running the 'apachectl configtest' command.  I
tried using the binary version of the module earlier and got similar errors:

cougar:/web/apache#./bin/apachectl configtest
Syntax error on line 206 of /web/apache_1.3.22/conf/httpd.conf:
Cannot load /web/apache_1.3.22/libexec/mod_webapp.so into server: ld.so.1:
/web/apache_1.3.22/bin/httpd: fatal: relocation error: file
/web/apache_1.3.22/libexec/mod_webapp.so: symbol __lshrdi3: referenced
symbol not found

I did a clean configure of the webapp module and it looked like it compiled
okay. I am using Apache 1.3.22.
creator: jim@mail.ucf.edu

text:
Did you use the same compiler to compile Apache and the WebApp 
module? What compiler and version did you use to compile them?
creator: pier@betaversion.org
robert@cpqd.com.br
text:
I already had the same problem on my Sparc/Solaris 2.7. 
To SOLVE IT, follow these steps:

1- Install Gcc 2.95.3
2- Set an environment variable named LIBS to "-L/usr/local/lib/gcc-lib/sparc-
sun-solaris2.8/2.95.3 -lgcc"
3- Make sure you are using "ld" from Solaris
4- Compile Apache
5- Compile Webapp

This worked for me (Tomcat 4.0.1/Webapp 1.0/Apache 1.3.22).

Robert Bafini
robert@cpqd.com.br
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 4198 ***
creator: pier@betaversion.org
